title: pOH of Water at Zero Celsius

content.question: The value of <math alttext="K w" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>w</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> for water at <math alttext="0 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="1 times 10 to the negative 15 power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>15</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the <math alttext="p O H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pOH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of water at <math alttext="0 degrees Celsius" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
